nodes.key: As far back as I can remember, I always wanted to be a gangster

nodes.key: To me, being a gangster was better than being President of the United States

nodes.key: To me it meant being somebody in a neighborhood full of nobodies

nodes.key: TUDDY VARIO, the sloppily-dressed, solidly-built HOOD who runs the cabstand

nodes.key: They weren’t like anyone else. They did whatever they wanted. They'd double-park in front of the hydrant and nobody ever gave them a ticket. In the summer when they played cards all night, nobody ever called the cops
